newsitem.title: USA: American Business prices $72.5 mln certificates.
newsitem.headline: American Business prices $72.5 mln certificates.

text.p: American Business Financial Services Inc said Monday that through two subsidiaries, it has priced a $72.75 million securitization backed by business and consumer purpose home equity loans.

The transaction consists of three Class A securities which the company expects will each receive a triple-A rating from Standard & Poor's Corp and Moody's Investor Service Inc. The expected settlement date is March 27.
The company said the transaction will be structured as a Real Estate Mortgage Investment Conduit entitled ABFS Mortgage Loan Trust 1997-1.
The Class A-1 certificates are in the aggregate amount of $32.1 million and were priced to yield 6.371 percent with an issue price of 99-31+.
The Class A-2 certificates are in the aggregate amount of $20.6 million and were priced to yield 6.936 percent with an issue price of 99-31.
The Class A-3 certificates are in the aggregate amount of $20.05 million and were priced to yield 7.595 percent with an issue price of 99-30+.
American Business Financial Services, Inc. is a financial services holding company.
